entry.title: About Me
entry.summary:
I have a Master of Technology degree in Computer Science & Engineering from IIT Kanpur and a Bachelor’s of Engineering again in Computer Science & Engineering from Punjab Engineering College (now renamed to PEC University of Technology, a deemed university). Currently, I am an independent IT consultant. I have about 20+ years of experience in the IT sector. You can read more about my professional profile on LinkedIn.

I intend to blog here on the things that interest me like:

  • Indian Culture: specifically Saṃskṛta and various Stotras.
  • Programming problems solved just for fun (usually in Clojure or Python).
  • Technology

I studied Saṃskṛta till class 12th and then, off and on, I have kept in touch with it. The topic of my Master’s dissertation was “Sandhi Analysis using Two-Level Morphology” where I tried to apply Finite State Transducers to the problem of Sandhi Analysis. I have been doing a little bit of service at Sri Ma Trust and that has allowed me to keep in touch with Sanskrit over the years. And then, sometime back, I found friends who were avid Saṃskṛta enthusiasts and that has kindled a new interest in Saṃskṛta. Currently, I am studying Vedapāṭha and Aṣṭādhyāyī from two separate teachers.

Credits

This site has been created with the Pelican, a Python based static blog generator. The theme used is pelican-octopress-theme which has been adapted from duilio and jakevdp.
